Reviews.Title: “Noisy and not a good night's rest”
Reviews.Author: khbeard
Reviews.Content: We planned to use this hotel as a midnight (3 am east coast time) to early morning departure and figured it couldn't be that bad, as other Motel 6 nights have been fine. Not so. As stated in other reports, the hotel employee was behind glass when we checked in after a late flight at 11:30 pm. I can't hold that against them, but there were problems with the room - specifically the door would not close without a lot of effort, resulting in a loud noise for my west coast daughter who was still sleeping when we woke up. Also, the outlets in the bathroom did not work at all, limiting use of hair dryers, and normal needs for charging cell phones, laptops, etc. But the worst was a local train that passed frequently during the night, using sustained loud (enough to wake us all) horn blast as it passed by the highway intersection. I would not recommend this hotel as there are other Phoenix low cost hotels that would likely be a better choice.

Reviews.Title: “Not exactly a safe neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: thelonious22
Reviews.Content: It was not a good sign when the cashier just stayed behind a thick glass and all transactions were done through the little slot underneath the thick glass...not the nicest looking neighborhood...the rooms are bit dirtier than the typical Motel 6...it is very close to the airport so if you have a super early flight the next morning, it's adequate for a night.,

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mauisonia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were passing by AZ and needed a cheap but clean/ quiet hotel to sleep as were were very tired. As soon as we saw this Motel 6 (chain I recall for being unexpensive, family oriented and clean back in the day) I said, let's try it! BAD IDEA! I guess the ADULT SEX shop across the street should've told us something! First, the room smelled muggy, just horrible! we had to keep the door open for 10 minutes, then as I wanted to get into bed and open it, I see something gross! Other peoples HAIRS on the pillowcases and sheets, one of them pubic..I immediatley asked the guy at reception to change rooms. He was actually very nice (name is Luis) and gave us another room, but the other one was just as bad. Not too many hairs but still found mascara marks on the sheets and stuff. We ended up wrapping the towels around the pillows and just using the sheet that looked the cleanest. In the middle of the night some fight broke out outside, needless to say I did not get a good night's sleep and was scared they were going to steal our rental car! We got up at 7am and left as soon as we could. Noisy as hell too! BEWARE THIS HOTEL

Reviews.Title: “This was a BAD Motel 6”
Reviews.Author: jjlw31
Reviews.Content: Just gotta say...the sheets were so thin I didn't get under the covers. YUCK. Sometimes Motel 6 works well; but pick another place for proximity to the Phoenix Sky Harbor airport.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely dreadful.”
Reviews.Author: xxgrrxx
Reviews.Content: This place was disgusting. The floors were dirty, the staff was disrespectful, and there were so many creepy and suspicious looking people. They will never again get my money.

Reviews.Title: “Ethan's on the road again”
Reviews.Author: TravelerWithDog
Reviews.Content: Small area for dogs to wander. Not a great area for anyone to wander at night. Fast food within a couple blocks and the same with gas stations. Have stayed there many times and always get hit up for money or cigarettes at area gas stations or when walking. At $40 for the high season this Motel 6 just does not have the area or grounds to justify the cost. For picking up and dropping off at the airport it works fine. Staff has always been friendly and accommodating. Rooms have burns on the furniture, very wobbly chairs, and there was hair in the tub. Unless they can come down in price it is not worth it for the adverage traveler, sightseer, or family. Planes, trains, and trucks go by and overhead all night.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to stay there for just one...”
Reviews.Author: harryJpotter
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay there for just one night because you want to catch a flight the next day this hotel is the right for you: it is really close to the airport (right behind the perimeter fence of the airport) and the rental car center is just one block away. The area is safe and the connection via Metro Rail to go Downtown is very convenient. BUT: bring your earplugs!! This is the noisiest surrounding for a motel I know of so far: airplanes keep starting and landing all night there is a railway track right in front of the parking lot and there are trains passing by all night as well. You can hear and feel them in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Depeche Mode”
Reviews.Author: vayne417
Reviews.Content: This place was geat cheap and clean what else could we ask for! I really enjoyed the fact that it was so close and super clean i cannot compliment the clean enough, we have stayed at some pretty dirty places. Stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Steer Clear Of This One”
Reviews.Author: VIAJERO225
Reviews.Content: A BAD choice for a motel in Phoenix if your plans include sleep. I blundered into it by reserving on line WITHOUT READING THE REVIEWS... and trying to save a few bucks- bad mistake. The place is just north of the west end of the Sky Harbor Airport and about 100 feet from an Amtrak/ freight railroad crossing, in an industrial area. A "one-on-one" girlie place is across the street and there is an "adult toy store" nearby. Classy neighborhood. Strange locals milling about in the parking lot. The roar of the planes and the ringing of the railroad crossing penetrates the rooms like there are no walls and the trains themselves always blow their whistles- about a hundred times- as they approach the crossing - even in the middle of the night. The freight trains are about a hundred cars long. There are absolutely no amenities here, but the price is still pretty high- about fifty bucks- You can go to the La Quinta and live in absolute luxury for another twenty bucks- it WILL be worth it. The bedspreads are so garishly colored with the Motel 6 logo that the decor alone will keep you awake. Little tiny towels in a little tiny bathroom. No chairs to sit in to watch TV. The staff is nice, though and they have free (!) coffee in the office in the morning. And- they have an all-night security to guard to keep the derelicts from stealing the stuff out of your car. There IS a pool. Do not go here. Repeat- DO NOT GO HERE.

Reviews.Title: “No good”
Reviews.Author: unclesam79
Reviews.Content: Dirty room, hairs, dust etc. Suspicious activity in the parking lot from locals.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little Place, service with a Smile!”
Reviews.Author: HormelM2008
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent a Month in Arizona, the night before we were coming home to Idaho, we had the opportunity to come accross a Motel 6 in Phoenix near the Phoenix Airport. We were tired and the location near the rental car center and the airport was excellent.. After check in we asked the gentleman wworking the desk where we could grab a quick bite to eat, the staff at this hotel gave us numerous suggestions and wef ound ourselves at a wonderful local place. Check in was pleasant, staff was wonderful and the room was clean, comfortable and smelled nice. I would defintly recommend this Motel 6, our past experinces with Motel 6 have been so-so, but this hotel was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay At This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: roxie_42824
Reviews.Content: Items were missing out of room. After housekeeping was in. Little misc. items that you would not realize were gone until you went for them. When reported the manager accused of leaving door open. Also after reporting them. I was considered a disturbance and can not stay at any other motel. Guest relations can not provide any information. In how to speak to upper level management.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here only if you need to save a few dollars.”
Reviews.Author: vegandimsum
Reviews.Content: Here are the things that I found lacking. 1. Shampoo 2. TV set quality and reception 3. Safety, like if I wanted to walk to find something to eat. 4. Quiet. It is next to train tracks and the airport runway. The train whistles blew loudly in the early morning and the planes took off noisily. I would stay there again if I wanted a plain room for a bargain (for Phoenix) price, but only if I had a car to drive to find supper. The room was clean and the people were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “2 star neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: desertchick
Reviews.Content: The property is not locate in a very nice neighborhood, it does not have a laundromat and the staff wasn't especially friendly. However, the room was clean and the pool was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but noisy.”
Reviews.Author: james19745
Reviews.Content: Good location, few blocks from Sky Harbor Intl. Airport. Check-in took us 20 minutes because we were 9 friends, we all had to show the passport. Some Motel 6 properties only ask one per room. Rooms were standard, nothing fancy but no complaints. AC was too cold but we adjusted the temperature with separate control. The only bad news was the terrible noise coming from train horns every 30-45 minutes, late night and early morning included. Believe me, that could wake up anyone. We could not sleep well and left at 5 am, the airport was close but next time we will look for a property in a quiet area.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a night after flying long haul”
Reviews.Author: MalcolmC
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the motel after a long haul flight from London that arived in Phoenix 25 hours late after two unscheduled stops en-route. The room was all right, nothing fancy just a standard motel room. The facilities for a one night stay were fine. The reception staff were OK especially the woman the following morning who was extremely helpful in pointing us in the right direction for Las Vegas missing out traffic lights and road works and heavy traffic. On return to Phoenix 17 days later after travelling arond Nevada and Arizona we pulled into the car park to stop befoire handing the car in and it looked better than the first impressions on the first night. The 24hr Waffle House next door was good for breakfast. Location is very good for Sky Harbor Airport and for the car rental pick up and drop off points

HotelInfo.Name: Motel 6 Phoenix Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 214 S 24th St, I-10 at Exit #148/Jefferson St, Phoenix, AZ 85034
